image.altText: Three identical teenaged boys stand in a line smiling in the stands of a sporting stadium.

props.synopsis: One of the St Edmund's College boys seriously injured after being hit by an allegedly stolen car on the way to school is petitioning the ACT government to put a pedestrian bridge over the road where he was hit.

title.children: Canberra boy hit by car outside school calls for pedestrian overpass

image.altText: An ACT ambulance driving along a road *good generic

props.synopsis: For several hours this week, there were only four ambulances capable of transporting stretchered patients on Canberra's roads. The ideal number in operation is nine.

title.children: 'A lot of good luck': Just four ACT stretchered ambulances in operation one night this week

image.altText: The portait shows three young people appearing to play outside.

props.synopsis: An image of three First Nations girls gesturing with their middle fingers towards the camera, highlighting the issue of Indigenous children in youth detention, wins the National Photographic Portrait Prize.

title.children: Portrait prize winner highlights plight of Indigenous youth detainees

image.altText: rachael brown majura primary p&c

props.synopsis: The ACT government changes its plans for a Canberra school expansion after data showed they expected fewer enrolments than had been predicted during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.children: Canberra school dismayed after $50 million expansion walked back

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a red and blue checkered shirt speaks with his hands in front of a courthouse

props.synopsis: Mike Worsman was aged 12 when he was sexually abused in the 1990s in Canberra. He says the system's let him down.

title.children: 'Mere 16 months of peace': Survivor angered by abuser's sentence

image.altText: ANU signage with Genevieve Bell and Julie Bishop

props.synopsis: The prestige of the Australian National University is fast fading. It must now respond to explosive allegations.

title.children: How one of the world's most prestigious universities fell from grace

image.altText: New ACT number plate

props.synopsis: Canberra drivers to be refunded after toll operators charge for trips made by motorists with duplicate number plates.

title.children: Full refunds promised after toll charges for trips never taken

image.altText: A large building with a lot of windows against a clear sky.

props.synopsis: Millions of irreplaceable biodiversity specimens are re-homed at a new CSIRO facility in Canberra as its chief executive speaks for the first time about plans for change at the organisation.

title.children: CSIRO opens $90 million 'cutting edge' research facility

image.altText: An AFL player smothers another player's kick in a group of players

props.synopsis: The Lions have become the second team to secure September football with a comprehensive 57-point drubbing of Fremantle. Follow live.

title.children: Brisbane secures finals football with Dockers demolition in Perth

image.altText: Dragons coach Shane Flanagan looks on during a press conference

props.synopsis: St George Illawarra coach Shane Flanagan has claimed he no longer knows what constitutes an obstruction, after his side's four-point loss on Friday night.

title.children: 'Don't know the rules': Dragons coach fumes over Warriors try in defeat

image.altText: A drawing of a man's side profile, he is wearing reading glasses.

props.synopsis: Matt Wright became "hostile and abusive" after his helicopter pilots pulled out of a crocodile egg-collecting run due to safety concerns a month before a fatal crash, a court has heard.

title.children: Matt Wright 'abusive' after pilots pulled pin amid 'catastrophic' storm, jury hears

image.altText: A group poses for a photo on chairs in front of a row of national flags.

props.synopsis: The Pacific's leaders are grappling with Solomon Islands' contentious decision to block all outsiders from the region's most important annual meeting next month. So what does the episode say about how strategic competition is reshaping the region?

title.children: Why both China and Taiwan aren't welcome at the Pacific's top meeting next month

image.altText: A pile of bright plastic lies in water in front of a cityscape.

props.synopsis: Several countries voiced bitter disappointment as the talks unravelled, but said they were prepared for future negotiations — despite six rounds of talks over three years.

title.children: Landmark plastics treaty falls apart as nations fail to find consensus for pollution

image.altText: A man in a red and gold guernsey talks to a dozen young men in red and gold guernseys

props.synopsis: A regional football club in Western Australia is under the spotlight after its now former league coach made a sexist slur about influencer Tammy Hembrow.

title.children: Football coach fired for online sexist slur against Tammy Hembrow

image.altText: A large poster saying 'Justice for Kumanjayi White' laid on the lawn, with other protest posters and people surrounding.

props.synopsis: NT police have provided an update on their investigation into the Warlpiri man's death in custody in Alice Springs, saying it is at an "advanced state" but still waiting on a forensic pathology report.

title.children: Police say investigation into Kumanjayi White's death at 'advanced state'

image.altText: A police man stands between a police vehicle and residential fence.

props.synopsis: A 62-year-old man has died in police custody during the execution of a search warrant at a home in Palmerston, south of Darwin.

title.children: Police investigating man's death in custody south of Darwin

image.altText: A golden and black-furred rat with a white-tipped tail walks up a log with a fish in its mouth.

props.synopsis: After a nail-biting countdown, the rakali — or 'Australian water rat' — is crowned the nation's most underrated animal, with the palm cockatoo and the cuttlefish nabbing a podium finish.

title.children: Rakali crowned Australia's most underrated animal, beating palm cockatoo and cuttlefish

image.altText: An aerial shot of suburban homes stretching into the distance.

props.synopsis: As industry leaders and the federal government prepare for next week's economic summit, two economists have started a national conversation by arguing that, to make Australia's tax system fairer, we should consider taxing home owner-occupancy. Here's what that means.

title.children: 'Imputed rent' and what it could mean for a fairer Australia

image.altText: A group of people in the Young Liberal club stand together for a photo

props.synopsis: The University of Wollongong Liberal Club revokes the membership of its former president and first life member after Ward was found guilty of sexually abusing two young men.

title.children: Ex-MP dumped by university Liberal club for 'abhorrent' crimes

image.altText: woman shopping for fry pan wearing a mask

props.synopsis: We look at the pros and cons of cast iron, stainless steel, and non-stick cookware to see what might suit your household best.

title.children: Cast iron, non-stick or stainless steel: Which cooking surface should you be using?

image.altText: David Stratton (for VT column)

props.synopsis: I write this to remember David and his incomparable contribution to Australian and world cinema, but also to implore myself and anyone else reading this: don't wait.

title.children: David Stratton reminds us not to wait to share the magic of cinema

image.altText: Emma Rebellato in South Australia

props.synopsis: I've lived away from South Australia for almost three years now, and coming home to see the algal bloom hit home.

title.children: How going home to see the algal bloom struck a personal chord

image.altText: A group of police officers in high-vis vests gather on a footpath around a police car.

props.synopsis: Online threats posted on social media referencing school shootings and apparently directed at students at Mt Lawley Senior High School are being investigated by police.

title.children: Police investigating TikTok shooting threats at Perth high school

image.altText: A woman and man with sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Emma Lovell died in December 2022, after being stabbed by the juvenile — now aged 20 — on her front lawn in North Lakes.

title.children: Sentence for juvenile who murdered Emma Lovell reduced on appeal

image.altText: A composite image showing six book covers on a peach background

props.synopsis: Darren McCallum's daughter inspired him to write his first book for young children, The Wobbly Bike, which is among the winners of the 2025 CBCA Book of the Year awards.

title.children: Darwin tradie wins coveted award for a picture book about his daughter

image.altText: A woman sitting at a table talking wearing a white shirt, colourful scarf and sunglasses on her head.

props.synopsis: The case against a Darling Downs man charged with the murder of his mother-in-law faces ongoing extensive delays in the wake of a Queensland DNA lab scandal.

title.children: Queensland police wait nearly four years for DNA results in murder case

image.altText: Christian Petracca in possession of the football

props.synopsis: Melbourne vice-captain Jack Viney says the club has internally discussed Christian Petracca and Jake Melksham's body language during the team's loss to the Western Bulldogs last weekend.

title.children: Dees address Petracca and Melksham's mid-game 'flare-up' at teen teammate

image.altText: A muscular man wearing a backpack and black T-shirt and cap stands on a cliff edge.

props.synopsis: A security contractor held a senior role in what a US legal service says is an "anti-government extremist group" linked to the hard right. Now he works on an Israel- and US-backed humanitarian aid project in Gaza.

title.children: Fears a mysterious Gaza aid agency 'not all it seems to be'

image.altText: A man plays with his earring while looking at something out of shot

props.synopsis: Aamir Khan says audiences downloading his films illegally have helped grow his popularity far beyond India's borders, while a technological revolution is helping pave a way forward for domestic fans.

title.children: A Bollywood legend thanks piracy and embraces $2 films

image.altText: A man and a woman in green and gold tracksuit tops fold their arms and look down at the camera.

props.synopsis: Sickness ruled their childhoods, but Emma, Jacob and their parents weren't giving up. Now, thanks to transplants, the duo are representing Australia at the World Transplant Games.

title.children: These siblings weren't sure they'd live past 30 years old, now they're representing Australia

image.altText: Collins and Richard Marles stand side by side with Australian and NZ flags behind them.

props.synopsis: New Zealand's defence minister says the United States has carried the burden on defence for countries like Australia and her own, as the White House pressures the Albanese government to lift defence spending.

title.children: NZ defence minister sympathises with Trump's push to lift defence spending

image.altText: Richard Fidler and Sarah Kanowski sit on a radio panel smiling

props.synopsis: Over the course of two decades, Richard Fidler and Sarah Kanowski have enthralled millions, telling the remarkable stories of more than 3,200 guests. We asked listeners to share which Conversations guests have stayed with them long after the mic was turned off.

title.children: Listeners find stories of 'resilience and joy' in 20 years of Conversations

image.altText: Portrait of Princess Anne in a black ceremonial hat and gold epaulettes laughs

props.synopsis: As Princess Anne celebrates her 75th birthday those who have worked beside her reveal her no-nonsense approach to a privileged life.

title.children: Princess Anne takes a no-nonsense approach to turning 75
